about.description:
Orange add-on for text mining. It provides access to publicly available
data, like NY Times, Twitter and PubMed. Further, it provides tools for
preprocessing, constructing vector spaces (like bag-of-words and topic
modeling) and visualizations like word cloud and geo map. All features
can be combined with powerful data mining techniques from the Orange
data mining framework.
about.summary: Orange3 add-on for analyzing textual data.

about.description:
Orange add-on for text mining. It provides access to publicly available
data, like NY Times, Twitter and PubMed. Further, it provides tools for
preprocessing, constructing vector spaces (like bag-of-words and topic
modeling) and visualizations like word cloud and geo map. All features
can be combined with powerful data mining techniques from the Orange
data mining framework.
about.summary: Orange3 add-on for analyzing textual data.

name: orange3-text
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "Orange3-Text" %}
{% set version = "1.12.2" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 5dfc6f92e08c04928be2f7d1673c72e1b0c4a9e6a3f84c550385712f6bfaff40

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script:
    # conda is not happy with special characters
    # error appears on some machines wich cannot handle special characters when validating package
    # since manifest includes special characters and system cannot find them
    # https://github.com/gem/oq-engine/issues/6347
    # removing them since they are used only for testing
    - rm -f orangecontrib/text/widgets/tests/data/good/sample_txt_ž.txt
    - rm -f orangecontrib/text/widgets/tests/data/documents/good/sample_txt_ž.txt
    - {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.7
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3.7
    - anyqt
    - beautifulsoup4
    - biopython
    - conllu
    - docx2txt >=0.6
    - gensim >=4.3.0
    - httpx
    - lemmagen3
    - lxml
    - nltk >=3.0.5
    - numpy
    - odfpy >=1.3.5
    - orange3 >=3.33.0
    - orange-canvas-core
    - orange-widget-base >=4.14.0
    - owlready2
    - pandas
    - pdfminer3k >=1.3.1
    - pyclipper >=1.2.0
    - pyqtgraph
    - pyyaml
    - requests
    - scikit-learn
    - scipy
    - serverfiles
    - simhash >=1.11.0
    - six
    - tweepy >=4.0.0
    - ufal.udpipe >=1.2.0.3
    - wikipedia
    - yake

test:
  commands:
    # make sure all required dependencies are present
    - python -c "import pkg_resources; pkg_resources.require('Orange3-Text')"
  imports:
    - orangecontrib.text

about:
  home: https://github.com/biolab/orange3-text
  license: AGPL-3.0-only
  license_family: AGPL
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Orange3 add-on for analyzing textual data.

  description: |
    Orange add-on for text mining. It provides access to publicly available
    data, like NY Times, Twitter and PubMed. Further, it provides tools for
    preprocessing, constructing vector spaces (like bag-of-words and topic
    modeling) and visualizations like word cloud and geo map. All features
    can be combined with powerful data mining techniques from the Orange
    data mining framework.

  doc_url: http://orange3-text.readthedocs.io
  dev_url: https://github.com/biolab/orange3-text

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ajdapretnar
    - primozgodec
